outcomes.0: Immediately asked, immediately done. You find yourself in a bed, undressed, and the person next to you looks like your lover. Watching at yourself, you see that you are attached on the bed and... you're missing your legs and arms. You can only move with your torso. Seeing your distress, Perotin ends his song with "all this was just a dream", and you are back as before. You will however need to take a rest.
outcomes.1: Immediately asked, immediately done. You find yourself in the sea, far from everything, with your only crew member, your lover. Arriving at a desert island, you find a cross on the floor. It is a treasure, full of a nice loot, and containing a very useful item. Greed and stinginess were right, you choose to leave the island alone. While coming back, you found Perotin, singing to get the money found there, as a gift. After those adventures, you start walking again, in with your item.
outcomes.2: Knowing you heroic quest to save the princess, the minstrel decided to sing a song about one of the possible following of you adventure after saving her. But not knowing much about you relationship with the princess, if preferred to tell the story of "The old and the fake monster", in which you are the monster of course. Already knowing the synopsis, Perotin succeeded to not change you, probably because of the under dosage of his drugs. Having not entered in the story, you thank him for this beautiful story, and continue you trip, aware of this useless waste of time.

outcomes.0: This famous bard, not knowing much about the adventurer's work, decides to tell a simple trip in a forest, like you know well. Disappointed about this song, and about Perotin, you choose to continue your adventure.
outcomes.1: Perotin decides to make you live the moment at which you asked him to sing the song. The problem, is that the drugs are so real that you answer the same thing you did, and the minstrel always does the same. It then created an hallucino-temporal loop, because of the talents of Perotin, and your stupidity. Perotin, the only consent of the scene that you live with him had mercy for you at the end of the day and released you from this bad drug.
outcomes.2: Perotin decides to make you see the future, whether it's real or only fiction of your mind, and by the occasion let you earn some money: you get yourself around an old abandoned castle. Looking around you, you find a passage full of traps. You finally avoid all of them, and find a big treasure room. But our favorite minstrel, before the end of your looting, run away with all your booty, leaving you with the main chest, which contains much money, and a surprising item useful to save the princess. Amused, you continue this funny adventure, still a bit under the influence of this drug, called the γ-hydroxybutyric acid according to rumors.

singHero.text: Sing about our life, and our heroic history.

outcomes.0: Taking your words back, you find yourself in an old monastery, in the countryside. Your lover and yourself are staying in this dingy place, harvesting just enough food to survive. You fulfill yourself in this story, due to the overdose of the drugs, that you don't see time going forward. Waking you up, after a few minutes, Perotin tells you that the drugs makes the use feel a few minutes, but those are months. Fortunately, or you would be dead of old age. Meditative, you continue your trip.
outcomes.1: Not understanding your wish, for an uncolored love, Perotin thinks that you are depressive, he then chooses to sing a comforting song, to get you rid of this sudden depression. This song made you feel very well.
outcomes.2: Seeing you knowing the dispassionate love, the minstrel makes you a song in which your lover is yourself. Having a big disagreement with yourself, the minstrel stops the song, and ask you a compensation for the fight that you have in front of his fans. Still in the story, you thought you were leaving yourself, which makes you be sad. You then go away, leaving some money to Perotin.

outcomes.0: The minstrel loving his homeland of ever, fills your request and singed the dukes. The duke of the next region came this way, and heard this soft melody, rocking his heart. At the end of the song, he rewards you with a big gold bag.
outcomes.1: The minstrel, hating the actual power, by his song decides to make a revolution. He take you with him, drugs you, and makes you think that the rest of the people are on their way to the king's room. Unfortunately, one of the string of the mandoline breaks, and the music stops. You however are in the king's room, alone, with a fork. You immediately get arrested for madness.
outcomes.2: Perotin, knowing a bit your story to save the princess, decides to make you live the view of her mother for a day, so that you learn a bit more about this distressed woman. But the queen's life is boring for you, and appart from some gossips and thoughts of woman on her child, you don't get any useful informations because of the fact that those are caused by magic drugs of Perotin. At the end of the day, you take your body back, and continue your trip.

singRoyalty.text: Sing about the royalty, and the power in place.

outcomes.0: Perotin, sad of this request, decides to make you live the role of minstrel in the song and... You see yourself arriving, to ask your choice, but you force yourself to sing it, and it loops for a long time. At a moment, our favorite minstrel stops the song, and give you the antidote, to this hallucinatory poison. Afraid of what just happened, and of the duration of this loop, you run away to know what time is it. And... it's the evening now.
outcomes.1: Perotin, nostalgic, decides to tell his beginnings in the profession in his song. He tells how his master gave him his melodious lessons, and his softening drugs. You feel this sweetness in the teacher's words that inhibits you with all your being. At the end of his last lesson, Perissien, Perotin's master, decides to give you a present, as he had received from his predecessors, but to prevent this magical instrument, this mandolin, from leaving you since its beginnings, Perotin changes the end of the song in order to give you an object that could be useful to you for the rest of your adventure.
outcomes.2: The excellent minstrel Perotin decides to tell a dream he would like to live, whether real or hallucinated: at the beginning you are alone, in the village alley, with your guitar. You sing for yourself the joys of the work and the sadness of life, when a monarch passes in the main avenue. This one, hearing the beautiful melody, comes towards you and asks if you could create a song for him on the theme of his love. At the end of your sweet ballad just made up, he thanks you and gives you a big bag of gold, considering that this man was real. Happy with this music, you decide to share it with Perotin as a donation.

46.text: While crossing a small village, you found the most famous minstrel of the region, called Perotin. His is so good in his work, that he wanted to let you live a song, because of his powerful drugs. Having the courage of going talk to him, he would like you to choose the following theme. What do you suggest?

outcomes.0: You think about the villager's offer but do not answer it. He insists and you leave without saying a word, thoughtful.
outcomes.1: You do not react, and when your interlocutor leaves, you run away from the village so you don't get in trouble with the lord.
outcomes.2: You think about the villager's offer but you are quickly arrested by guards who overheard the conversation. Your protests do not save you one day in jail.

outcomes.0: You decide not to take part in this madness and leave as soon as possible. Unfortunately, you pass by a guard, hungry of wealth, that asks you to stop. You are quickly immobilized and stripped.
outcomes.1: You do not want to risk your life and so, decline the offer before leaving by thanking the villagers for welcoming you.
outcomes.2: You declare yourself exhausted, they find you a shelter for you to rest. You take advantage of the night to flee the village.
outcomes.3: You tell them that you cannot fight the Lord because you are exhausted. They agree to offer you shelter for you to rest. You take an item during the night and flee as quickly as possible.
outcomes.4: You tell the villagers that you are exhausted, and ask them to leave you a night in order to prepare. They accept and when the night falls, you gather your belongings and flee the village. In your rush you unfortunately drop part of your purse.

goAway.text: Do not take risks and leave as soon as possible.

outcomes.0: With the help of the entire village, a siege of the castle is organized. No reaction was observed in the castle, where people seemed to accept the slight inconvenience caused by the blocking of the roads in the surroundings. After a few hours, the bridge gates are lowered. A group of 30 men rush to a campsite established by you. A bloody flight begins. Within the crowds, you find a horse and escape.
outcomes.1: You and the villagers plan a rebellion! Unfortunately, when you decide to attack a guard, the villagers are too frightened to follow you and flee. Your opponent gives you a violent strike that knocks you down, the guard takes advantage of the situation to steal your purse.
outcomes.2: You decide to organize an uprising! Tho, a villager betrays you to obtain a prize. The castle´s guards hasten to haunt you. You manage to distract them, not without having suffered a few blows.
outcomes.3: You take advantage of your knight status to visit the castle's lord, after introductions, you reveal the reason of your coming by sticking a dagger in his heart. The guards react immediately and surround you. One of them gives you a sword strike that you manage to dodge, but another rushes at you and pierces you with his blade.
outcomes.4: You try to siege the lord's castle with the village but the night falls, therefore, you decide to sleep in front of the castle. The lord took advantage of the situation to go out with his man and reach the camp, but a villager alerts everyone. You rush on the lord and send him an agile sword strike. The guards surrender and the villagers give you a purse filled with gold to thank you for helping them!
outcomes.5: You go see the lord and announce him that his village is planning a rebellion. After a long discussion, you manage to gain his trust and seize the opportunity to pierce his heart with a dagger. The Lord's loyal guards rush on you and immobilize you. One of them propose to execute you in front of the villagers to get the message across, but the rebellion is raging! The villagers end up making the guards flee and offer you a large purse filled with gold to thank you.
outcomes.6: You go see the Lord and announce him that a rebellion is being planned. After a long discussion, you manage to gain his trust and seize the opportunity to pierce his heart with a dagger. The loyal guards attack you, but other's that only wanted the Lord's death help you flee. Back in the village, we offer you a bit of money and an item that could be useful.

help.text: Help the villagers dethrone the lord.

outcomes.0: You go visit the lord, tell him about the villager's request and help him find the person. He thanks you and you leave.
outcomes.1: You go visit the lord and tell him of the reigning betrayal in the nearby village, you announce him that you are ready to seize it in exchange of a large amount of money. He accepts your offer and you lead him to the traitor who is executed before your eyes. On the road, you verify the purse that he gave you and see that it only contains a small amount of money!
outcomes.2: You go visit the Lord and tell him about the villager's request and explain to him that you can help him find the rebel, but in exchange you want a nice sum of money. He accepts and asks you to help him find him. Together, you get there, but when you ask the Lord for the money, this one refuses. A duel begins but the lord is no match for your swordsmanship. However, he didn't have much wealth on him.
outcomes.3: You go visit the Lord, but the guards won't let you pass. You let them know that this is important, but they do not want to hear anything. Under their threats, you leave again with a swearing, helpless.
outcomes.4: You decide to tell the Lord what you've heard, but on your way you see a villager who seems to have guessed your intention to betray the village. You try to force the way but reinforcements arrive fast. Surrounded by the hating crowd, you get knocked down and severely struck.

tell.text: Tell the lord the plans of the village.

47.text: You have been so tired that you have trouble walking. This is when you see a village. Saved! Not without pain, you finally arrive to the village. From the sympathy of a group of villagers, you find a place to sleep and food to eat. You plan to leave soon, however, a villager asks you for a favor. Shining you with vast wealth, the villager requests you to help them dethrone the chatelain of the neighboring castle.

outcomes.0: You watch the knight, not knowing what to do about this colossus in armor. Finally, you get back on your way.
outcomes.1:
You watch the knight, not knowing what to do about this colossus in armor. Taking your courage in both hands, you face him in a duel...
and are miserably defeated by him. He ask for all your money in exchange for your life.
outcomes.2: You watch the knight, not knowing what to do about this colossus in armor. You suddenly have an idea, you wait until the night and be in total darkness before you discreetly go towards the tower. The door is closed, the knight gone. You climb the tower and enter by a window. You rummage through it from top to bottom but find nothing except food. You eat on site and take as much as you can. This good meal has restored your strengths, you are now feeling better than ever.
outcomes.3: Not knowing what to do, you engage the discussion and sympathize with the knight. You gradually get the discussion on the artifact and enjoy your speaker talent in advance. The knight, convinced that you are worthy of possessing it, will get you the artifact. He brings it to you, as promised. You thank him and go to search for someone to buy it. You see what seems to be a merchant, but it was a thief shooting you an arrow in the leg. He steals the artifact from you and runs away. Blessed and helpless, you watch him running away with your loot.
outcomes.4: Not knowing what to do, you engage the discussion and sympathize with the knight. You gradually get the discussion on the artifact and enjoy your speaker talent in advance. Against all expectations, when you ask him about the artifact he refuses. Not wishing to bother him, you do not insist more and talk to the knight a little before you get back to your path.

outcomes.0: Ready to fight, you come closer pretending to want to discuss an arrangement. Close enough to your enemy, you draw your sword and lunge at him. Unfortunately for you, the knight was on the lookout and has colossal strength which he uses to disarm you before pushing you back to the ground.
outcomes.1:
Ready to fight but barely knowing your opponent, you approach under the pretext of wanting to discuss a settlement. Close enough to your opponent, you draw your sword and lunge at him. The knight barely has time to react when you knock him out with the knob of your sword.
It's not enough. You strike him a second shot, and this time he falls down on the ground. Then you try to open the tower door, in vain. You check whether the guard has the key, but he does not carry it. And so you leave, disappointed.
outcomes.2: Ready to fight but not knowing much about your opponent, you approach under the pretext of wanting to discuss a settlement. Close enough to your enemy, you draw your sword and knock him out with the knob. Then you try to open the tower door but it is locked. Therefore, you search the guard and quickly find a key. You open the door, once inside, you have no difficulty to find the artefact. You find a marchant after searching for one hour. This one buys you the artifact for the modest sum of five hundred gold pieces.
outcomes.3: Ready to fight but not knowing your opponent, you come together on the pretext of wanting to discuss an arrangement. Close to your opponent, you draw your sword and knock him with the knob. Then you try to open the tower door but it is locked... You search the guard and quickly find a key. You open the door, inside you don't find any difficulty to find the artifact. So you go in search of a merchant and find one easily. He steals the artifact with a skillful move, but you also reach to steal one of his objects. Hoping that this one has value, you look at what it is.
outcomes.4: Barely knowing your opponent, you approach with the excuse of wanting to discuss an arrangement. Once close enough to your enemy you draw your sword to stun him with the knob. Unfortunately for you, the knight was far stronger and faster than you. The knight runs at you, makes a right hook and pushes you back by hitting you in the stomach with his foot before hitting you with a powerful uppercut. On the ground, on the edge of fainting, you are not able to get up.
outcomes.5: The knight brandishes his sword to intimidate you. In front of this colossus, you hesitate to flee, but decide to stay. You will fight this knight although your chances of defeating him are low. Your opponent blocks your blows one by one without making the smallest effort before knocking you to the ground. Disarmed, on the ground, you know the fight is over. It is then that the knight tells you: "You are very brave, so here is your reward." He gives you an item before moving to the entrance of the tower.
outcomes.6: Ready to fight, you quickly lunge at your opponent, drawing your sword. The knight barely had time to draw his weapon before you came on him. At this moment you realize your mistake. He has an armor, not you. So you try to knock him out with the knob of your sword, several times. It seems to have confused him and you get ready to try again. But before you can do it, your opponent injures you at the leg. You are on the ground, unable to get up. The knight moves over you and raises his sword. You close your eyes, and hear your own scream.

outcomes.0: You start talking to him, and find him very nice. You gradually steer the discussion towards his role here, he explains that he is the tower's guardian. You ask him if it is possible for you to enter, but he refuses. You get back on your way.
outcomes.1: You engage the discussion and talk for several minutes. The knight didn't say a word. Understanding that he will not talk, you abandon any discussion as you leave.
outcomes.2: You engage the discussion, the knight immediately orders you to move on. You don't want to leave, but as soon as he shows you his sword, you don't hesitate any longer.
outcomes.3: You start a discussion but the knight stays quiet. Understanding that any attempt to dialogue is useless, you leave.
outcomes.4: You start a discussion and spend over an hour with the knight. You gradually steer the discussion around the artefact and enjoy in advance your oratory skills. The knight goes away to get the artefact while you, obsessed by your triumph, do not notice the person behind you until he stabs you in the back. You fall to the ground.
outcomes.5: You engage the knight in discussion and attempt to sympathise for over an hour. He does not want to let you pass by in any way. With no other choice, you draw your sword and attack him. With no other choice, you draw your sword and attack him. The knight, insensitive to your blows thanks to his armor, hits you violently in the face before knocking you out with a stroke of his knob.
outcomes.6: You start a discussion and sympathize with the knight. You gradually steer the discussion around the artefact and enjoy in advance your oratory skills. The knight, convinced that you are worthy to possess it, goes to fetch the artefact for you. He brings it to you, as promised. You thank him and go looking for a merchant. You manage to sell it for the modest sum of five hundred gold coins.

48.text: You are looking for an artefact. You covet it because, according to legends, it offers wealth and power to its owner. After your quest has led you to a tower that is supposed to contain the treasure, you find yourself face to face with a knight in armor blocking the entrance. The latter stays impassive in spite of your injunctions...

outcomes.0: You catch it and swallow it in one fell swoop, it doesn't take you long to realize that not baking the poor creature was a mistake.
outcomes.1: You catch it and bake it, its flesh is delicious and enables you to regain strength for the journey.

outcomes.0: You watch the creature struggle with all its strength for a little time, then leave.
outcomes.1: This spectacle is of no interest to you and you continue on your way immediately.
outcomes.2: You continue without paying attention to the creature, clumsy, you step in a hole and twist your ankle. You will need to heal yourself.

outcomes.0: You get it back on its feet and then watch it go, proud to have done a good deed.
outcomes.1: Barely getting back on its feet, the little crustacean pinches your ankle and leaves in the direction of the water.
outcomes.2: You hurry to help it and watch it go back towards the water. A few seconds later you see a huge mass emerging from the sea, it's a chest full of gold offered to you by a horde of these little crustaceans.

helpIt.text: Help it and put it back on its feet.

outcomes.0: You decide to take the little creature with you but it pinches you violently in the face and hurries to escape.
outcomes.1: You decide to take the little creature with you. A few hours later, as you check how the frail creature is feeling, you discover a bloody heap deep in your bag, the hermit crab has been crushed by the contents of your bag, you spend about ten minutes cleaning your bag and leave.
outcomes.2: You decide to take the little creature with you. A few hours later you find a small stream, you decide to leave your little friend there and continue on your way.

49.text: After walking for several minutes on the beach you meet a strange little creature, this is a hermit crab! It seems to have turned on its shell...

outcomes.0: You spent a good hour picking up the scattered pieces from the bottom of the water, but it seems to have been worth it!
It's sometimes good to not be too lazy. You haven't wasted any time!
outcomes.1: No time to rest! There's a princess to save!
outcomes.2: You make the choice to not stop and continue forward.
outcomes.3: You continue your adventure without paying any more attention to this fountain.
outcomes.4: You have to know to rest when you are tired. Exhausted, you collapse a few minutes after passing the fountain. You have to sleep before you can continue!

keepGoing.text: Do not stop and continue on your way.

outcomes.0: It feels good to rest sometimes... these 30 minutes of rest have been beneficial!
outcomes.1: It feels good to rest sometimes. You rest for an hour and continue on your way.
outcomes.2: It feels good to rest sometimes... but don't forget to move on! After wasting 3 hours resting, you are back on the road.

rest.text: Rest and drink to regain strength.

outcomes.0: You approach the villagers and ask them about these strange fruits. They explain to you that they are coconuts and that their flesh is eaten when the shell of the fruit is opened and that their juice is famous throughout the country. The villagers offer you to taste it and you do not say no to the offer. Indeed, the juice is refreshing and the chair soothes your appetite. You leave after having thanked the villagers for this discovery by giving them some coins and continue on your way.
outcomes.1: You approach the villagers and ask them about these strange fruits. As one of them explains to you, the others start to draw closer to you. Suddenly, someone gives you an arm lock while the others throw themselves at you to steal your things. After having been beaten beforehand, you resume your journey.
outcomes.2: You approach the villagers and ask them about these strange fruits. They explain to you that they are coconuts and that their flesh is eaten when the shell of the fruit is opened and that their juice is famous throughout the country. With this precious information, you hit the road again.

ask.text: Talk to the villagers to question them.

outcomes.0: watch for a moment the spectacle of the villagers harvesting these singular fruits and resume your journey under the blazing sun.
outcomes.1: of these fruits falls next to you. You take it in your hands and examine it carefully before resuming your journey.

outcomes.0: After you have rested well, you decide to leave before the sunset.
outcomes.1: As you are about to leave, you realize that the group of villagers is heading towards you, they then begin to extort money from you and you give them money so that they leave you alone.
outcomes.2: You decide to leave, without a glance, you leave the Coco village to continue your quest.

leave.text: Leave the village without further waiting.

outcomes.0: You continue your nap, but one of the fruits unhooks and comes crashing down onto your head. You are wounded and bleed a lot, some villagers who saw you come to help you, you will have to take a moment to recover.
outcomes.1: You are sleeping for a moment. When you wake up to find that the sun is starting to set and the temperature is dropping, you resume your route, invigorated.
outcomes.2: You decide to continue your nap. When you wake up, you get up, ready to go, and notice that you are missing something in your pockets, it is your wallet. So you decide to leave, disappointed.

nap.text: Continue your nap at the foot of the tree.

50.text: During your trip, you reach a small hamlet named Coco Village, it is very hot and you need to rest. The places do not seem hostile to you, so you make a stop in this oasis. While you are resting at the foot of a coconut tree, you see a group of villagers climbing trees to catch fruits you've never seen before, they are round like balloons and hard like wood and do not seem appealing.

outcomes.0: After having hesitated for a long time in front of the possibilities open to you, the Sun is about to set, so you settle down to rest.
outcomes.1: After hesitating for a long time about the possibilities available to you, you decide to try to climb half a dozen steps before changing your mind, finding the climb too perilous. As you pivot your foot back to go down, it slips and you roll down the stairs. You stand up painfully to see with difficulty that you are badly involved. You get back on your way, annoyed by this unfortunate incident.
outcomes.2: You sit down on the ground lined with clovers to think about what you want to do. Quickly, a fox faces you. He slowly approaches you and ends up reaching for one of your hands, puts his nose on it, yaps at you and runs away. You decide to follow the path this friendly animal has just blazed for you.

outcomes.0: Shortly after turning around, you meet a crying and scared little boy by the wayside. He explains to you that he fled during a bandit attack on his parents merchandise cart. You rush to offer your help, the child accepts immediately. After walking two long hours, you find the parents of the child alive, but hurted. As you bid them farewell, the mother gives you a purse filled with gold.
outcomes.1: Shortly after turning around, you meet a crying and scared little boy by the wayside. He explains to you that he fled during a bandit attack on his parents merchandise cart. You rush to offer your help, the child accepts immediately. After walking for a few minutes, a group of heavily armed bandit attacks you by surprise. This trap will not have been fatal to you, but you lose many gold coins during your escape.
outcomes.2: Shortly after turning around, you hear the noise of pans clashing and approaching you. It is a traveler in search of new culinary flavors who was about to set up camp in order to rest. During the conservation, you discover her first name: Lucya. She's offering you a pie that delights your palate. Satisfied, rested and delighted with your hazardous encounter, you still decide to get back on your path.

outcomes.0: You search for a few moments around the base of the stairs, without success. Two more steps let you discover a few gold coins scattered here and there among the weeds. Delighted with your skinny discovery, you continue your adventure whistling.
outcomes.1: After a handful of minutes searching the surroundings, you find a used leather satchel, almost entirely hidden under a heavy stone. By opening it, you discover a papyrus where only a few words are still legible: "staircase", "cave", "camp" and "Xetrix". This name sounds familiar to you, but especially disappointed not to have found any treasure, you resume your journey.
outcomes.2: Suddenly, when looking around, an enormous rock gets off celestrum mount and hits you in its fall. You don't even have time to react and look at the rock still falling, hitting you at the arm violently.

outcomes.0: You begin the perilous ascent of the staircase which leads you to the entrance of a cave. You enter it and discover a very old abandoned camp. While digging a little you discover an object that seems useful to you for the advancement of your quest and decided to carefully go down the stairs.
outcomes.1: You begin the perilous ascent of the staircase which leads you to the entrance of a cave. You enter it and discover a very old abandoned camp. After having inspected the whole cave which turns out to be safe, you decide to settle there to sleep since there remains a rather comfortable bed of straw.
outcomes.2: After having carefully climbed a few steps lined with moss, you slip and tumble down the few meters that separate you from the ground. Slightly stunned and injured, you give up the idea of trying your luck again and continue your journey.

51.text: As you reach the bottom of the Mount Celestrum, you spot a tortuous staircase cut in the left side of the Mount. By getting closer, the steps turns out to be sharps and covered with moss.

outcomes.0: You refuse to play with children and go away.

In front of the rubble rain, you are forced to flee, out of reach of children. You realize that you have been hit in the head and the wound is bleeding profusely, you will need treatment.
outcomes.2: You refuse, and the children get angry. Seeing that the situation could turn sour, you quickly hit the road.

outcomes.0: Faced with your lack of respondent, the children lose interest in you and go to play elsewhere. So you resume your journey.
outcomes.1: Seeing you lost in your thoughts, the kids tie the laces together. When you come out of this trance state, you stumble and fall face down on the ground.
outcomes.2: You just sit there for hours, and when you come back to your senses, you realize your purse is gone. You continue on your way, annoyed.

outcomes.0: Not understanding the rules of the game very well, you are quickly put aside and resume your journey without the children worrying about you.
outcomes.1: You play with them until their parents arrive, finding you suspicious, they repudiate you from their village by threatening you. You get back on the road without asking for your rest.
outcomes.2: Playing the role of the runaway you are chased by the kids. As you look over your shoulder to gauge the distance between them and you, you trip over a root and injure yourself. Children leave you to your sad fate when they see your inability to continue playing. You will need to be treated.

outcomes.0: After playing for a while, the Kids notice that the Sun is setting and are forced to tell you good bye.
outcomes.1: During the friendly fight, one of the children hurts you superficially.
outcomes.2: Without doing it intentionally, you cut the cheek of one of the children... Embarrassed, you give him some coins so that he can pay for his care.
outcomes.3: Very energetic, the kids turn you round for a while. However, after twenty minutes you put a stop to the game.

outcomes.0: While you explain to the children how to position themselves at best to shoot, one of them, a little backward manages to bandage his bow, and, before you can do anything, shoot the arrow that comes to your leg. Wounded, you leave them to find a place to cure yourself.
outcomes.1: You explain to the children how to place themselves to shoot and the children do well. You spend the rest of the day training them in archery. Before you left them you were warmly thanked by a small present from your apprentices of the day. You leave them and resume your journey.
outcomes.2: Very quickly, you notice that the children are not yet strong enough to tighten the rope, so you say that you will come back to train them when they are older and resume your journey.

teach.text: Teach them how to use a Bow.

outcomes.0: With nothing special happening on the road, you succeed in reaching the building where you have to deliver your package. A man comes out and hands you your due. You set off again for the next part of your adventures.
outcomes.1: You pick up the package and head off in the direction the courier points you. You quickly fall into an ambush and get robbed of the package and your purse. Still in shock, you decide to take a rest under a nearby tree.
outcomes.2: You take the package from the courier's hands and leave for the house he indicated to you. Arrived at your destination, you find yourself unable to locate the house despite long research. You finally decide to keep the object and continue your way.

outcomes.0: You Politely decline, explaining that you are occupied. You go to rest under a nearby tree.

outcomes.2: You politely reject the offer. The outraged man throws the package in your face and orders you to deliver it for him! You take the package for yourself and go away from this obnoxious character. You come out with a pretty bruise on your face and an item that will surely come in handy.

outcomes.0: You remain silent in front of man. He doesn't quite know how to react to your bliss. After 5 minutes, he decides to accost another man to have the package delivered to him.
outcomes.1: You hesitate then end up refusing and continue your journey without worrying about the future of this package.
outcomes.2: You have no answer to this proposition. The man is not disturbing you more when he understands that you will not accept his request. You leave it for continuing your journey.

outcomes.0: You take the package and store it in your bag. You assure the man that it will be delivered before nightfall. A bit later, you open the package and discover a beautiful painting. You continue on your way and come across a painting expert's building, where you decide to get the painting you just stole assessed. You show your work to the painter, who calls you every name under the sun. It was to him that the package was intended! You decide to compensate him and you apologize to him. Taken with remorse, you immediately return to your way.
outcomes.1: You take the package. On your road, you cross the path of an itinerant trader. You call out to him to buy the package. You get a very good price for it. You continue on your way, without any remorse.
outcomes.2: You promise to the courier to deliver the package and return to the inn that hosted you the night before. You decide to open the package in order to see the content and find out that it is completely empty. What a waste!
outcomes.3: You decide to steal the package and resell it. However, since you were not in a hurry, you decide to sit down near a river. You quickly joiny by what seems to be a wandering trader. Having no need for his trinkets, you offer to buy the package. The man, at the curiosity picked by your mysterious packet, accepts your offer. You will never know the contents of this package but the few pieces you have taken from it are enough for you.

She explains to you that she has no money, but that she can exchange your package for an item from her cart. You trade the packet for an item you think it's useful and continuing your journey.

The man introduces himself to you as a courier and begs you to help him. You notice that he is exhausted and in a bad way. He asks you to deliver the package he has before nightfall to a secluded house nearby. He tells you that in exchange for this good deed, the man who receives the package will offer you a bag full of gold coins.

You jump to the place of bets and steal as much money as you can, raced by the villagers, before fleeing the village.

Absolutely furious, you run on him to beat him, but the knight knocks you out with the pommel of his sword.

Once you are reputed, the Lord proposes doing you to become a knight, you politely refuse his offer and thank him for the delicious meal. You feel much better ahead.

The battle begins, you know there is no chance of defeating your opponent, but you try to resist anyway. It only takes a minute for him to defeat you. You get back on your way, shameful of your defeat.
outcomes.1: Understanding the Lord's distress, you offer him your help. You are then equipped before the duel begins. You fight valiantly but are just as easily overcome by your opponent. It is when he slashes you with his blade that you bitterly regret having offered your help. Indeed, it is a death match. And you just lost it. You close your eyes, and the pain goes away. You wake up a few hours later, seriously injured.

Recognizing that you have no chance at all, you defend yourself the best you can. Your opponent, impatient, lowers his guard and you take advantage of it to attack him. You manage to put him to the ground before disarming him. You emerge victorious from the arena, the Lord comes to meet you to give you a purse full of gold. You thank him before you get back on your way.
outcomes.3: Understanding the distress of the Lord, you propose to him to settle the conflict by using your words. He promises you a reward if you succeed. Determined, you go to meet the knight once he arrives in the village and tell him that you want to negotiate with his lord. He accepts and he brings you at his home. You get on quickly with him and ask him to cancel the duel. You say to him that after that could takes place the negotiations to resolve the conflict. He accepts and you come back with him to Boug-Coton to announce the news. The Lord gives to you a purse filled with gold to thank you.
outcomes.4: Understanding the distress of the Lord, you propose to him to settle the conflict by using your words. He promises you a reward if you succeed. To solve it, a fight is organized between their best combatants, but all here are mediocre and the duel begins soon.

You then stand up, watch the island drift away on the horizon and take stock of your adventures.

The motion of the boat lulls you to sleep, and you soon feel your mind wandering to your adventures, falling asleep a few minutes later.
outcomes.1: You've been through a lot on this trip, so you refuse, as you don't want to get any more dehydrated. Instead, you ask the ship's master for some water. But you don't realize you're falling into a deep sleep until he returns.

outcomes.0: The captain is waiting for you to take his gift. But you've fallen asleep in a fraction of a second, which he quickly realizes. So he goes back to steering his boat, leaving you to sleep where you are.

67.text: After a short walk, you arrive at the boat that previously brought you to this inhospitable island. Seeing your fatigue and injuries, the captain hastens to order his crew to weigh anchor. Once seated on deck, you see him arrive with a mug of beer in his hand, which he hands to you.

outcomes.0: You look at the calendar, and discover that a tournament is about to start! You thus decide to go there and, after a few hours of battling, you reach the finals. However, your opponent is simply too strong, and you lose the fight. As you still made it to the finals, you win a purse full of gold, before continuing on your way.
outcomes.1: You look at the calendar, and notice that you are in Lapland, the 6th month of the year. You then decide to go out and eat a pancake at a nearby stand. This food is so good you feel really happy. You resume your journey, well sated.
outcomes.2: When you see the calendar, you remember the posters in the streets talking about a treasure hunt. You decide to take part. After two hours of searching, you can't find anything. You decide to turn back.
outcomes.3: You are looking at the calendar, and you notice something of interest in today's entry: Mead competition! Confident in your strong alcohol resistance, you decide to give it a try. You end up winning the contest, as well as a reward! You are also totally drunk, however.

outcomes.0: You hang around the library and don't notice the minutes passing. At closing time, you step outside and realize that it's already late. You set off again without further ado.
outcomes.1: You're amazed at the number of books and the wealth of knowledge that emanates from these premises. Shortly afterwards, the librarian beckons: the building is about to close. Disappointed, you turn back to continue your adventures.
outcomes.2: You stay in the library for several minutes, amazed by all the knowledge held within. You sit down, thoughtful. Suddenly, a reader comes by and disturb your thoughts, "Hansel and Gretel" by the brothers Grimm in hand. He asks that you give him your seat, as you are in his most favourite spot. Confused, you leave, without any new knowledge.

outcomes.0: You decide to read a book. It's about cooking and preparing delicious meals. You write down the recipe before going to find the ingredients. Once you've found them, you follow the instructions to the letter. You taste your dish before feeling its benefits, then set off again.
outcomes.1: You pick up a book and start reading. The book is about arithmetic. However, this has never been your strong point: almost 10 minutes later, you decide to put the book down and continue on your way.
outcomes.2: You're reading a cookbook. It talks about a delicious dish. Aroused, you decide to prepare the dish. But you don't quite follow the instructions, and after eating, you don't feel well...
outcomes.3: You pick up the first book you come across. It is about alchemy and the diverse benefits of some plants. After carefully studying its content, you put it down, convinced that it will be useful on your following adventures.

outcomes.0: You manage to steal a dusty old book and sneak out of the building to find a buyer on the city's main avenues. However, you notice that no one is interested in the book, not least because it's badly damaged and even has torn pages. So you abandon it and move on.
outcomes.1: You sneak out of the library without anyone noticing you. You managed to steal a book, and now try to sell it to passers-by. A man decides to buy it for a few gold coins. Once the transaction is completed, you get back on track.
outcomes.2: You try to steal a golden book discreetly, but the librarian catches you red-handed. She demands that you return the precious book, and with it, compensation! Disappointed and ashamed, you return the book and compensate her with a large handful of your savings to avoid going to prison...

steal.text: Attempt to steal a book and resell it.

68.text: After strolling through the streets of Claire de Ville, you come across a building whose entrance is framed by two stone owl statues. As you approach, you realize that this is the town's library. You decide to enter the building to pass the time. On one of the entrance walls hangs a calendar made of large leaves bound together by a leather strap.

outcomes.0: You feel like you're participating in a knighthood ceremony, since Donia puts the end of the staff on both your shoulders - first on the left one, then on the right - to give you her blessings. Either way, you don't feel that much different from before.
outcomes.1: You feel overpowered after her blessing... until Donia leaves. You try to find her, embarrassed to have believed such folly, but you can't. You leave, ashamed and confused, and swear, a little too late, that she won't fool you again.
outcomes.2: As soon as Donia uses her "blessing" on you, she also throw some strange blue powder in your face. You get drowsy and she helps you to walk to one of the nearest trees, where you fall asleep. You dream of being in the royal palace, during a social event. You see the princess approaching you, with her face hidden by a dark veil, since you are actually oblivious to her physical appearance. You spend the rest of the dream dancing with her. You sleep a few hours feeling refreshed.

outcomes.0: She seems disappointed, but offers you a red rose as a gift for the princess. You set off again, just as disappointed as she is, having received only a single, measly flower.
outcomes.1: Rather than a blessing, you ask her if she knows of a place in this forest where you could rest for a while. She then takes you to her house, where you are served good food and wine. The latter is incredibly pleasant and you finish the whole bottle, dragging yourselves afterwards to a bed. As you sleep, you have a rather peculiar nightmare: Donia is a stooped old woman, the archetypal witch, and she wants to kill you before baking you in her oven. The real Donia leaves you asleep and continues on her way.

outcomes.0: You frown, and soon tell her that fairies don't exist and that she's completely delusional. Furious, Donia uses her stick to beat you up, leaving you lying wounded on a bed of leaves.
outcomes.1: You use all your tact and try to make her understand that fairies only exist in children's stories and tales of drunken adventurers, without much success. Wanting to prove you wrong, Donia pulls out a large quantity of red powder from a small satchel strapped to her waist, which she throws in your face. You're too close to her to dodge, so you inhale the powder. Your vision blurs and you lose your senses. You let Donia hold your hands and guide you to a clearing. You see many little fairies twirling about. In reality, they're wasps. Seeing your arrival as a threat, they sting you repeatedly. You've been poisoned and will need some time to get better.

outcomes.0: As you stare at her in silence for quite a while, Donia seems to lose interest in you, and walks away without saying anything more. But you continue to stare. Without a thought. It's only a few hours later that you come to your senses, and continue your journey, as if nothing had happened...

69.text: As you cross the Old Man's Forest, a beautiful woman comes running up to you. Her long hair is the color of a stormy sea, and she's dressed in a graceful silver gown, with a corset adorned with tiny sapphires. Her right hand holds a hawthorn staff. Such an appearance makes you immediately think that this is what a fairy should look like, if such a creature exists: both wild and dazzling. You're worried, but the stranger smiles sweetly and announces that her name is Donia. She declares herself to be a Fae, confirming your first impressions. You don't quite believe this, and sense the trickery afoot, but her staff seems dangerous enough for you not to let her know. Donia then offers you her blessing, believing she can be useful in your quest for the princess.

outcomes.0: By forcing the door open, you seriously hurt yourself, you must absolutely be healed!
outcomes.1: After spending almost an hour trying to get into the house, you finally give up. On your way out, you find an object that might come in handy!
outcomes.2: You enter the house and put down your belongings to rest. Having fallen into a deep sleep, you'll need to rest before continuing your adventure.
outcomes.3: You enter the house and search around for about fifteen minutes. On your way out, you find an object that might come in handy!
outcomes.4: You enter the house and search around for about fifteen minutes. You finally give up your search without having found anything.

outcomes.0: You've been standing still for almost 15 minutes, so it's time to get moving!
You continue on your way without worrying about the house.

7.text: You've discovered a house! It looks abandoned...

outcomes.0: After a moment's reflection, you finally decide to enter the tomb to cool off in the shade and rest.
outcomes.1: As you hesitate about what to do, the sandstorm intensifies. You step into the passage, safe in the knowledge that the gusts have subsided.
outcomes.2: As you hesitate to decide what to do, a woman wearing an ice axe on her belt emerges from the trapdoor. She threatens you with a bandaged bow, then orders you to turn your back on her, which you do. A sharp blow to the temple leaves you confused for several minutes.

outcomes.0: You wander the galleries for a while, looking for any hidden rooms. Eventually, you come to a dead end. Fearing you'll get lost exploring further, you decide to turn back.
outcomes.1: After wandering through several rooms, including one filled with spoiled victuals, you arrive in a vast room where gold is the name of the game. It makes up the walls, the various objects, the clothes and even the chests. In one corner, you spot something you might find useful. Then you fill up your biggest purse and leave the maze.
outcomes.2: Once through the trapdoor, you walk until you come to a dead end. You decide to get out, for fear of getting lost. As you reach the trapdoor, you are savagely attacked by an individual wearing a brown hat and carrying a whip on his belt. You somehow manage to dodge most of the blows, and fight back. You fight for a long time, but finally deliver the decisive blow. While searching him, you discover a small purse containing a substantial sum of money.
outcomes.3: Once through the trapdoor, you walk until you discover a burial chamber, the underground is a tomb! Wanting to turn back, you fail to recognize the corridors you're passing through, and wander for many hours before finding an exit. You resume your adventure as the full moon illuminates the silent desert as if it were daylight.
outcomes.4: After passing through the trapdoor, you step into the darkness and discover a strange place: an abandoned crypt, the underground tunnels resembling a funerary maze! You're tempted to turn back, but to your dismay, the corridors seem to play tricks on your senses and transform before you. You wander aimlessly for a time, before finally finding a way out.
outcomes.5: Once through the trapdoor, you walk to a room where a sphinx is enthroned, made entirely of gold! As if hypnotized, you approach it until your left foot lands on a slab, which sinks into the floor... Two golden arrows whistle eerily in your ears, while a third scratches your arm. It's not an unpleasant wound, but this trap urges you to evacuate.

outcomes.0: You decide to ignore the trapdoor: you feel it would be far too dangerous to explore an underground passage. The sandy gusts have subsided, which is a godsend for you!
outcomes.1: You decide to ignore the trapdoor and continue on your way, but the sandstorm becomes even more virulent. Without the slightest hesitation, you turn back for shelter. You decide to rest here until the storm is over.
outcomes.2: The gusts are getting stronger, so you tear off a piece of your top to protect your respiratory tracts. With difficulty, you take a few steps and spot several cacti, some with fruit. After picking up two of them, you quickly find a dune where you can take shelter. Once peeled, you discover that the fruit is delicious. Many minutes later, the storm has died down. You resume your adventure.
outcomes.3: After carefully closing the trapdoor, you continue on your way. Suddenly, the ground gives way beneath your feet. You fall into one of the underground rooms. In your fall, you cut your thigh. Fortunately, you get out with ease.

70.text: As you travel through the Dune, the air seems to grow drier and drier. As you move forward, grains of sand whirl around, forcing you to squint. Suddenly, you feel the ground firm up beneath your feet for the space of a step. Surprised, you push the sand aside to reveal a trapdoor and open it. A gigantic labyrinth is revealed before your astonished eyes.

outcomes.0: You follow the old man to the tent that serves as his home, and let him serve you a strange mixture that he says is a delicious peyote soup. Out of politeness, you drink it. It only takes a few moments for you to feel the effects of this demonic soup: your vision blurs, and the world sways. Suddenly frightened by the mad hermit, you flee into the desert. In the early hours of the morning, you wake up with a splitting headache, the effects of the peyote taking a while to wear off completely.
outcomes.1: You follow the old man to the tent that serves as his home and share a meal together around the fire, while he tells you his story. He explains that he and his brother separated for their hermitage following a disaster that killed their entire family, the only survivors being him and his brother. His story touches you deeply, and the name of another hermit whose name begins with an X sounds familiar... The desert is icy cold as you fall asleep by the fire with the hermit. When you wake up in the morning, you find a beautiful scorpion in one of your shoes. You throw it away and continue on your way.
outcomes.2: You follow the old man to the tent that serves as his home, and share a meal together around the fire as you recount your adventures. Once you've eaten your fill and thanked the hermit, you resume your journey through the desert, heading deeper into the wilderness.

outcomes.0: You politely decline the hermit's offer and continue your journey.
outcomes.1: Seeing that you're reluctant to accept, the old man pulls you by the arm and invites you to tea, where you chat with him as you sip the beverage. After a short while, you bid farewell to the old man and set off again.
outcomes.2: Seeing that you are reluctant to accept, the old man decides to offer you "an object from his personal collection". You accept the gift but remain reserved about staying in his company and decide to take your leave quickly.
outcomes.3: You decline his offer, but just as you're about to set off again, he calls out to you again, talking about anything and everything. After a while, finding him far too suspicious and thinking he's trying to set a trap for you, you decide to cut short his interminable monologue before fleeing as quickly as possible.

deny.text: Decline his offer and move on.

outcomes.0: The man looks suspicious and his gait is deceitful. As he stretches out his arm to ask if you're feeling well, you grab hold of him and shove him into the water before scurrying away.
outcomes.1: Seeing you reactionless, the old man gets offended, yells at you and throws a handful of sand in your face before walking away. Completely blinded, you head for the small body of water to rinse the sand from your eyes. After a few minutes, you feel better and go on your way.

outcomes.0: You let the man guide you to his tent and discreetly pick up a large stone while his back is turned to you. You then land a heavy blow on his hooded skull. The hermit collapses, blood spilling onto the cracked oasis floor. You decide to leave him like that, and head off to take a look inside the tent. Inside, you discover trunks set with jewels and objects in great quantity. You leave with a substantial sum of money, as well as an item you grabbed in a hurry. You quickly resume your crossing, unwilling to be caught red-handed.
outcomes.1: You let the man guide you to his tent and discreetly pick up a large stone while his back is turned to you. Just as you're about to hit him, he turns and pulls a dagger from his sleeve, cutting deep into your chest. You scramble for cover, doing your best to stop the blood flowing. As you flee, you hear the crazy old man's demented laughter.
outcomes.2: You let the man guide you to his tent and discreetly pick up a large stone while his back is turned to you. You land a heavy blow on his hooded head, the hermit collapses to the ground, and you are immediately overcome with remorse. You bandage the old man's head and lay him down on his mat to recover. When he wakes up, you apologize and give him some money in compensation for your misdeed.
outcomes.3: As you follow the old man, you pick up a stone from the ground behind his back. Discretion is not your strong suit, and the hermit immediately notices your suspicious silence. Realizing the situation, he repudiates you from his kyutchen with a punch the likes of which you've never received.

steal.text: Accept and take advantage of the night to steal his belongings.

71.text: As you cross the Kings' Valley, you catch sight of an oasis. Thirsty from your journey, you rush to the small body of water to drink. As you take a drink, you are startled by the sound of laughter behind you. As you turn around, a bearded old man with a large hood over his face faces you. He says his name is Xirtex and that he lives in this oasis. He offers to put you up in his home to help you recover from your journey, and to share your misadventures.

outcomes.0: Hesitantly, but finally galvanized by the din of the crowd, you ignore the judge and join in the general enthusiasm. You cheer the participants in the various events for hours!
outcomes.1: Your own life is far more important to you than the ephemeral glory of some tournament victory. You thank the judge and tell him that you won't be taking part in the tournament after all.

outcomes.0: The test seems a little difficult: you have to shoot three arrows at a straw target some 50 meters away. All three arrows land in the middle of the straw target. You're the winner! The beautiful Lady of the local Lord, Yseldia, comes to offer you a heavy purse, while you are dazzled by her ruby-set crown.
outcomes.1: The test seems a little difficult: you have to shoot three arrows at a straw placed about fifty meters away from you. You're not very skillful, so you miss two out of the three arrows and come last in the ranking! Happy to have been part of the general euphoria, you happily set off again.
outcomes.2: As you notch your first arrow, a sneeze startles you. You drop your bow, and your arrow comes to rest near the head of a muscular knight. He glares at you and starts to rush towards you. Adventure doesn't wait: you're back on the road in no time!

outcomes.0: After winning three jousts, you find yourself in the final against the Count of the neighboring region. He unhorses you with suppleness and ease. You finish second on the podium. As you are transfixed by the ruby-set crown of Yseldia, wife of the local lord, you absently accept a heavy purse from her delicate hands.
outcomes.1: A new jousting event is about to begin, and a groom has given you the gift of a gray double pony whose previous owner sadly passed away shortly before. You face Yvain, a renowned knight. You begin to gallop along with your adversary, who unhorses you with ease. As you land with a clatter on the dusty ground, your mount accidentally steps on one of your collarbones, making a sinister cracking sound.
outcomes.2: After spotting an unattended bay nag, you seize it to take part in the jousting. You're the winner! The local lord's wife, nicknamed Yseldia, gives you your rewards in person.
outcomes.3: Just as you feel the exhilaration of jousting on horseback beckoning, you remember that you don't have a horse to take part in this event. Disappointed, you grumble and continue on your way.

joinJoust.text: Take part in the jousting test.

outcomes.0: As you see the other participants' gleaming, sharp weapons, your courage melts like snow in the sun. You decide to slip away quietly before your unfinished life is snatched from you.
outcomes.1: After nearly dying with a blow from a halberd encrusted with green gems, you finally put your last opponent out of action. The Weapon Herald announces your crushing victory! The Lady of the Lord, named Yseldia, brings you your reward in person. As you thank her, you study her delicate face, the top of which is adorned with a sumptuous ruby-set crown.
outcomes.2: After easily defeating almost all your opponents, you start to tire and lose your last fight! You notice a nasty gash on your hand, and head off in the direction of the town's bone-setter. He dresses your wound and insists that you rest for a while.
outcomes.3: You've underestimated the level of your opponents and, as a result, one of them knocks you down. Despite your pleas, your opponent, armed with a halberd adorned with emeralds, sneers and lacerates your arm up to the shoulder.

outcomes.0: The rhythm, rhymes and sounds of your poem captivate the crowd. You're acclaimed the winner! Yseldia, wife of the local Lord, presents you with your prize, not without a touch of emotion.
outcomes.1: A few minutes before the results are announced, you notice that your purse is missing. You've probably had it stolen before you got there. Good thing you didn't have all your gold on you! You leave without waiting for the rest of the festivities, empty-handed.
outcomes.2: As you loudly proclaim your poem in a lilting voice, you notice a damsel eyeing you with much fervor. Just as you've finished your tirade, the young woman grabs your hand and starts running! A few alleys further on, the young lady kisses you! She's not your Princess, but you don't let her distract you, and explain that your heart's already in the right place. As you bid her farewell, she gives you an object that may prove useful in your further adventures.

joinPoetry.text: Take part in the poetry test.

outcomes.0: You manage to find a street kitchen owned by a mixed-race woman. Her first name, Lucya, rings a bell. Over the course of the conversation, Lucya explains that she used to work at the famous Boug-Coton inn. However, she was far too thirsty for exciting adventure to accept this sedentary lifestyle. Delighted by your interest, the woman offers you a small vial of spiced mead. You're now refreshed and ready for your own adventures.
outcomes.1: You can't find any street food stall: an entertainer tells you that a big banquet is planned for much later. Disappointed by this news, you decide to leave town.
outcomes.2: You manage to find a street kitchen owned by a mixed-race woman. Her first name, Lucya, rings a bell. Shortly after starting up a conversation with her, you learn that she intends to open her own inn if she becomes bored with her life as a culinary adventurer. Thinking you're a very nice person, Lucya offers you a homemade wafer. This singular honey-tasting cookie delights your palate.

searchFood.text: Change your mind and go in search of a food stall.

72.text: As you arrive on the outskirts of Claire de Ville, you discover that many of its inhabitants have moved outside the great walls: a seigneurial tournament is in full swing! On the hoardings attached to the walls, jesters, troubadours, minstrels, heralds, bards and storytellers vociferate with joy, cheering each blow of sword, lance or mace. Enthralled by the mayhem and general cheerfulness, you decide to try your luck. You spot the storytelling judge, who accepts your entry and asks you which test you'd like to take part in.

outcomes.0: You leave the crowd to slip discreetly into the back of the overweight man's cart. Inside his modest home on wheels, you spot a cat with her kittens and immediately understand the deception! You approach the trainer and demand money in exchange for your silence.
outcomes.1: Fascinated by these adorable babies, you sneak around to the back of the trainer's cart to see if there are any others, so you can steal one to sell at a good price. However, only a nursing cat is present. Out of spite, you grab the prettiest kitten and hide it in your pouch. Clever as you are, you quickly find someone willing to make the exchange.
outcomes.2: You move away from the crowd to find a better place to watch the show. Absorbed by the spectacle, you don't look where your feet are landing, and fall into a heavy open trunk, carelessly abandoned in the middle of the path. Before you know what's happening, the trunk closes on you, knocking you unconscious. You don't wake up until much later.

outcomes.0: You're totally uninterested in this spectacle and prefer to flee the crowd to avoid the usual thieves of all kinds. They never miss an opportunity to rob rich and poor alike, at events such as this where onlookers crowd together, facilitating their misdeeds.
outcomes.1: You immediately get back on the road. You don't have time for this kind of clowning. It takes you a long time to realize that you've gone the wrong way, so you turn back, cursing the loss of precious time.
outcomes.2: You quickly leave the show and trip over a bag carelessly left by a spectator. As you fall, you injure yourself very slightly. The bag is a faded brown, and although the leather is worn, it's in relatively good condition. You decide to rummage through the bag in the hope of finding some sort of compensation, and discover a small purse and an object that seems to be quite useful.
outcomes.3: You decide to continue your adventure, indifferent to the spectacle and the cheers of the crowd.

outcomes.0: You stay to watch the show, amazed by all the cuteness. You've really enjoyed watching this magnificent and grandiose performance, so you offer the trainer a few coins.
outcomes.1: You're eager to see the show, but it ends just as you arrive. Although your disappointment is immense, you leave.
outcomes.2: You watch the training, but after all you've been through since the start of your adventure, you're not impressed. You promptly leave the crowd and return to your adventurous life.

outcomes.0: You soon realize that these are kittens. There's no doubt about it, as you've had the good fortune to come across tigers before, and they give birth to much larger tiger cubs. You declare this outrageous, and demand financial compensation from the crooks. They agree, on condition that you leave immediately.
outcomes.1: You watch the trainer, whip in hand, ready to attack a young tiger. Like a good defender of lost causes, you rush at him, screaming for him to stop and release these poor tigers. Before you can reach him, the man flogs you, to the applause of the furious crowd.
outcomes.2: The show comes to an end and, like an excellent businessman, the trainer offers to pet the tigers for a few coins. You shout to the audience that it's a scam, that they're just kittens, but nobody listens to you. You scream until you lose your voice, and finally leave.

73.text: Walking nonchalantly along the Road of Wonders, you approach a small group of people in a semicircle around a heavyset man. As you reach them, you notice that he's dressed in a tight-fitting red show suit, with yellow shoulder inserts and blue briefs pulled over the uniform. On his imposing chest is a small royal-blue crest, which you can't quite make out. You make your way through the many onlookers to the front row. The man is a wildcat trainer with a long brown leather whip, teaching two magnificent baby tigers a trick.

outcomes.0: You rest for a few minutes before slowly leaving towards the passes. You end up exhausted on the other side, so you'll need to rest before setting off again!
You cross the forest without too much difficulty, and continue your journey!
outcomes.1: You walk slowly through the fir trees. On the way, you pick up fir branches and make small objects you can use or sell...
outcomes.2: You make your way slowly through the forest. Unfortunately, the ground is slippery and you fall into a ditch! You manage to climb out, but you're injured!

outcomes.0: In the end, you change your mind and decide to stay on the plains, which is less dangerous but also longer, so you lose a lot of time!
outcomes.1: You finally change your mind and decide to stay on the plains - it's less dangerous, but also longer, and you lose a lot of time! After a few kilometers, you stop to rest at an inn.

plains.text: Give up climbing to the top and stay close to the plains.

8.text: You've decided to take advantage of summer to head for the mountains as long as the passes aren't too snow-covered, but the climb is proving more difficult than you expected...

outcomes.0: For 15 minutes, you stare dumbly at the farmer fetching his pitchfork before leaving again.
After a quarter of an hour's searching, you find the pitchfork next to a pile of hay. To thank you, the farmer offers you a few coins.
outcomes.1: After half an hour's searching, you can't find the pitchfork. You do, however, discover an object that may be of use to you!
outcomes.2: Looking for the pitchfork, you step on it and give yourself a nasty gash.
outcomes.3: You search for the pitchfork for almost an hour but can't find it. You politely leave the farmer and continue on your way.

help.text: Help the farmer find his pitchfork.

outcomes.0: You continue on your way without paying any attention to the farmer.
outcomes.1: Continuing across the field, you come across the pitchfork and severely cut your foot.

9.text: In the middle of a field, you meet a farmer. He has lost his pitchfork...
